cards.title: Authorities in China’s Wuhan say citywide Covid-19 testing complete after case surge
cards.contenu: Authorities in the central Chinese city of Wuhan on Sunday said they had completed citywide testing of more than 11 million people for Covid-19 after a resurgence of cases more than a year after the coronavirus first emerged there.

cards.title: Bangladesh starts Covid-19 vaccination drive for Rohingya refugees
cards.contenu: Bangladesh began vaccinating thousands of Rohingya Muslims on Tuesday in the world’s largest refugee settlement, amid a surge in COVID-19 infections in the country, officials said.

cards.title: France plans rollout of Covid vaccine booster shots – but only for the vulnerable.
cards.contenu: Like the UK and Germany, France plans to roll out third doses of Covid-19 vaccines to vulnerable people in the autumn to combat the more contagious Delta variant. But the French government is reluctant to extend this booster shot to the whole population.

cards.title: China slams WHO plan to audit Wuhan lab in study of Covid-19 origins
cards.contenu: China on Thursday said a World Health Organization (WHO) proposal to audit Chinese labs as part of further investigation into the origins of the coronavirus pandemic showed disrespect and arrogance towards science.

cards.title: Covid-19: Poorer nations to get 250 million donated vaccine doses under Covax
cards.contenu: Covax is expecting to receive 250 million donated Covid-19 vaccine doses over the next six to eight weeks, the World Health Organization said Wednesday.

cards.title: Family feuds, a side effect of the Covid-19 vaccine
cards.contenu: As the French government ramps up efforts to expand the vaccination campaign against Covid-19, many continue to resist getting the jab. The situation has created tensions within some families, especially in light of recent announcements of tougher health policies.

cards.title: Germany sees Covid-19 spike as EU-wide vaccinations fall short of 70% target
cards.contenu: German Chancellor Angela Merkel warned on Thursday that new cases of Covid-19 in her country were rising exponentially, driven by the Delta variant, as EU officials said more than half of all European adults had been fully vaccinated, short of a 70% target set for the summer.
